processing_time.notes: Initial external queries were efficient and provided necessary identifiers (PMID) that were not present in the source document.

study_identification.title: The optimal oral dose selection of ibandronate in Japanese patients with osteoporosis based on pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties

authors.all_authors: Kiyohiko Nakai, Masato Tobinai, Junko Hashimoto, Satofumi Iida, Takehiko Kawanishi

study_identification.journal: European Journal of Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics

doi.cross_verification: VERIFIED - DOI resolves to the correct article on PubMed and publisher's website (SpringerLink)
doi.notes: DOI is clearly stated on the first page of the document.

pmid.source: External query: web_search('site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "The optimal oral dose selection of ibandronate in Japanese patients with osteoporosis based on pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties" Kiyohiko Nakai')
pmid.cross_verification: VERIFIED - PubMed entry for this PMID matches the DOI, title, and authors of the provided paper.
pmid.notes: PMID was not present in the document but was successfully located using a PubMed search.

registration_numbers.value: Not found after paper and external query
registration_numbers.source: Paper text analysis and external queries: web_search('site:clinicaltrials.gov "Chugai Pharmaceutical" ibandronate Japanese osteoporosis'), web_search('site:rctportal.niph.go.jp "Chugai Pharmaceutical" ibandronate')
registration_numbers.cross_verification: NOT_ATTEMPTED - No identifier found to verify.
registration_numbers.notes: The paper describes three clinical studies (two Phase I, one Phase II) but does not provide any trial registration numbers. External searches on ClinicalTrials.gov and the Japan Registry of Clinical Trials (via rctportal.niph.go.jp) using the sponsor name (Chugai Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd.) and drug did not yield unambiguously matching registrations for studies with the described design and timeframe.

integrity_resources.author_query_methods: Full name queries for first and last authors.

registry_resources.query_strategies: Used sponsor, drug, and population keywords.

retraction_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed, CrossRef, and Retraction Watch.

query_summary.comprehensive_coverage: YES - Primary and secondary tier resources for retraction were successfully queried with no results found.

expression_of_concern_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed and general web searches.
expression_of_concern_investigation.corrections_found: No corrections or errata were found linked to the DOI or PMID during the investigation.

query_summary.databases_queried: ['site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "The optimal oral dose selection of ibandronate" "expression of concern"']
query_summary.editorial_systems_investigated: Publisher website (SpringerLink) checked via DOI, no notices found.

team_integrity_investigation.findings: No issues found for the first author (Kiyohiko Nakai) or last author (Takehiko Kawanishi) across Retraction Watch and PubMed.

authors_investigated.findings: No retractions or expressions of concern found.
No retractions or expressions of concern found.

integrity_findings.publication_patterns: No concerning patterns observed. Authors are affiliated with the sponsoring pharmaceutical company, which is common for this type of study.

query_summary.registries_queried: ClinicalTrials.gov, rctportal.niph.go.jp (Japan Registry of Clinical Trials)
query_summary.query_methods: Searched by sponsor (Chugai Pharmaceutical), drug (ibandronate), and population (Japanese).

registration_timing_investigation.limitations: The primary limitation is the absence of trial registration numbers in the publication. Without these identifiers, it's not possible to definitively locate the trial records and assess registration timing. While the study was published in 2016, the underlying trials were conducted earlier, potentially before registration was a universal requirement.

reliability_metrics.database_consistency: Results were consistent across all queried resources.
reliability_metrics.findings_quality: Strong - The absence of negative findings across multiple databases provides a high degree of confidence.

overall_analysis.major_limitations: The inability to verify trial registration is the most significant limitation. While common for studies of this vintage, it prevents a full assessment of prospective vs. retrospective registration, which is a key transparency metric.
overall_analysis.methodology_effectiveness: The identifier-first methodology was effective. Finding the PMID via external query was crucial for cross-verification. The inability to find registration numbers highlights a limitation of the source document, not the methodology.

metadata.database_access_method: Web search for all external databases - no direct API access
metadata.web_search_strategy: Site-specific searches to avoid rate limiting
metadata.rate_limiting_eliminated: YES - using web_search() instead of direct database APIs
metadata.special_notes: The analyzed paper combines results from three separate clinical studies, complicating the search for a single trial registration.
metadata.data_quality_flags: The paper lacks trial registration information, which impacts transparency.
metadata.reproducibility_notes: Queries used: ['site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "The optimal oral dose selection of ibandronate in Japanese patients with osteoporosis based on pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties" Kiyohiko Nakai'], ['site:clinicaltrials.gov "Chugai Pharmaceutical" ibandronate Japanese osteoporosis'], ['site:rctportal.niph.go.jp "Chugai Pharmaceutical" ibandronate'], ['site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "10.1007/s13318-014-0242-5" retracted'], ['site:crossref.org "10.1007/s13318-014-0242-5" retraction'], ['site:retractionwatch.com "10.1007/s13318-014-0242-5"'], ['site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov "The optimal oral dose selection of ibandronate" "expression of concern"'], ['site:retractionwatch.com "Kiyohiko Nakai"'], ['site:retractionwatch.com "Takehiko Kawanishi"']
